snippet: When President Obama agreed to send small arms and ammunition to Syrian rebels, he had to be almost dragged into the decision by advisers, critics and even Bill Clinton.
abstract: Decision by Pres Obama to arm Syrian rebels has satisfied neither side in the Syrian debate; for those who pressed the White House to do more, belated agreement to send small arms after nearly 93,000 deaths seems too little, too late; for those who warn that Syria could become another Iraq or Libya, latest move comes across as another step down a slippery slope toward a messy outcome.
lead_paragraph: When President Obama agreed to send small arms and ammunition to Syrian rebels, he had to be almost dragged into the decision by advisers, critics and even Bill Clinton.

headline.main:
Heavy Pressure
Led to Decision
by Obama on
Syrian Arms
headline.print_headline: Heavy Pressure Led to Decision On Syrian Arms
